de.eckhartarnold.client

Class Filmstrip

  • java.lang.Object
    • Composite
      • de.eckhartarnold.client.Filmstrip
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResizeListener

    public class Filmstrip
extends Composite
implements ResizeListener
    Displays a row of thumbnail images as if on a film strip.
    Author:
    ecki

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Filmstrip.IPickImage
      An interface that encapsulates a callback method which is called when the user clicks on an image of the film strip.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void focusImage(int imageNr)
      Puts the focus on the given image, i.e. the film strip will be scrolled so that the focused image appears in the center.
      int getSlidingDuration()
      Returns the duration in milliseconds for sliding from one image to the next.
      protected void onLoad() 
      void onResized()
      Called after a parent widget has been resized.
      protected void onUnload() 
      void prepareResized()
      Removes the AbsolutePanel so that the image panels size can be determined correctly by the browser before calling onResized.
      void setPickImageCallback(Filmstrip.IPickImage callback)
      Sets the callback that is called when the user selects an image by clicking on a thumbnail or by turning the mouse wheel while the mouse pointer is located over the preview filmstrip.
      void setSlidingDuration(int duration)
      Sets the duration in milliseconds for sliding from one image to the next.

        public int getSlidingDuration()

      • onResized

        public void onResized()
        Description copied from interface: ResizeListener
        Called after a parent widget has been resized.
        Specified by:
        onResized in interface ResizeListener

      • prepareResized

        public void prepareResized()
        Removes the AbsolutePanel so that the image panels size can be determined correctly by the browser before calling onResized. The AbsolutePanel is restored by method onResized. This method therefore should always be used in conjunction with the method onResized.
        Specified by:
        prepareResized in interface ResizeListener

      • focusImage

        public void focusImage(int imageNr)
        Puts the focus on the given image, i.e. the film strip will be scrolled so that the focused image appears in the center. It's frame will be highlighted.
        Parameters:
        imageNr -

      • setPickImageCallback

        public void setPickImageCallback(Filmstrip.IPickImage callback)
        Sets the callback that is called when the user selects an image by clicking on a thumbnail or by turning the mouse wheel while the mouse pointer is located over the preview filmstrip.
        Parameters:
        callback - an Interface of the respective "callback" interface or null.

      • setSlidingDuration

        public void setSlidingDuration(int duration)
        Sets the duration in milliseconds for sliding from one image to the next.
        Parameters:
        duration - Duration in milliseconds
